meanings.definition: A mythical creature from Australian Aboriginal folklore.
meanings.sent1: The bunyip was a creature of legend in the stories told by the elders.
meanings.sent2: The bunyip was believed to have magical powers in the ancient tales.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the thought of a bunyip hiding in the shadows.
meanings.sent4: The mystery of the bunyip's existence captured the imagination of the villagers.
meanings.sent5: The bunyip was described as a fearsome beast with glowing eyes and sharp claws.

meanings.definition: A large, mysterious creature said to inhabit swamps and waterways in Australia.
meanings.sent1: The locals shared stories of the bunyip lurking in the murky waters.
meanings.sent2: Many explorers searched for the elusive bunyip in the vast wetlands.
meanings.sent3: Some claimed to have seen the bunyip, but others dismissed it as a myth.
meanings.sent4: The legend of the bunyip added an air of mystery to the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The bunyip's eerie calls echoed through the stillness of the night.
